alert.note: Alert for Lander (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 12 at 1:24PM PDT until June 12 at 1:45PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: The National Weather Service in Elko Nevada has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northeastern Lander County in north central Nevada... * Until 145 PM PDT. * At 121 PM PDT, a dust channel was 13 miles southwest of Battle Mountain, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Nevada Department of Transportation webcams. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. Reductions to visibility will occur along portions of I-80 from west of Battle Mountain to Dunphy and State Route 305 from Battle Mountain south to the Mill Creek Recreation area. Locations impacted include... Battle Mountain, Argenta, Mule Canyon Reclamation Project and Phoenix Mine. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
